column2: DavidM, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Limbrel and I have had very good results. column9: It seemed to work for nerve damage in my arm but after taking Limbrel 500mg twice a day for 30 days now I have noticed some side effects as in heartburn, fatiuge, gas, and most importantly; I already had major varicose veins; I now have a major blood clot.I was also not happy w/ the lack of information I was able to obtain on the drug from the doctors themselves.

column2: mssue, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This seemed to help for the first few days.  However, I experienced flu-like symptoms, joint and muscular pain (where it had not been previously) and generally felt ill.  Fortunately, it occurred to me that it might be the new medicine.  After discontinuing Limbrel for 5 days, I am feeling better but not back to pre-treatment health.

column2: CarolsCritters, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ****I'm the one who wrote on 12/22 & said I'd post an update****After my post that night I started vomiting violently and was wondering if I was going to have to go to the hospital. I stopped taking Limbrel right away, and low and behold 7 days later I'm back to 100%! No nausea, no vomiting, no fever, no achy feeling. It took the full 7 days because I noticed a 10-15% improvement each day. This is really scary stuff now that I've pretty much proven I was being poisoned by this drug. I had also quit all my regular RX's + Zyflamend, but I've been adding those back in with no illness. But I will admit, my deep arthritis pain has returned in every joint & spine, so I guess the Limbrel was doing a good job. However, no pain relief is worth feeling as bad as I did for so long. I realize that each persons body, diet & metabolism is different but for me it was a HORRIBLE experience after 3-4 months of build up in my body. I'm wondering if I should report this to FDA. I would certainly NOT recommend this drug due to my experience with it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I did a Google search for Limbrel reviews & found these 58 WebMD reviews which have been a GODSEND! I've been on Limbrel for about 4 months, prescribed by my Pain Mgmt doc for severe OA of the entire spine, hips, hands and feet (at the ripe old age of 52). All was ok until about 3 wks ago when I suddenly became very sick, vomited 2x, extreme ongoing nausea, stomach pains that resembled my bout with Norwalk Virus and/or when I had an ulcer + on/off bouts w/intestinal issues. I've tried Tagamet, Tums, Pepcid AC & Acidophilus daily but still have stomach pains + unlike the ulcer I've also been achy like the flu, running a low grade fever for the entire 3 wks, and can barely function during the day. When I got blood test results back from family doc my liver GGT count was way off + I was ANEMIC, so my doc corned me w/ possible alcoholism. On my end I kept thinking I had picked up something from the nursing home where I visit my father, but nurses said nothing similar was circulating. It's been VERY frustrating since I have 2 1/2 acres of rescued animals to care for daily and my husband has had to pick up the slack daily while I lay on the sofa + the animals keep coming up to me like something is wrong, checking to see if I'm OK since I'm normally very energetic and caring. I was pretty aggravated at Humana for not covering my Limbrel and I've been paying over $100 per month for this "FDA approved drug", only now to discover that it might be the source for my feeling HORRIBLE for so many weeks! After reading all of tonights online research I do believe that I'm suffering from Limbrel toxidity. Heck I had started telling people I thought my husband might be poisoning me! I never did pin point Limbrel as being very helpful w/pain mgmt since I also take Tramadol (Ultram) & Zyflamend (herbal anti-inflammatory). But after tonights reading I will certainly NOT take it tomorrow and see if I feel better! Thanks a MILLION to those who wrote reviews~ I'll try to post an update.

column2: sdem, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

All meds were stopped and after 3 months and colityis meds started having normal movements.  My doctor did not relate this to the Limbrel.  However after taking one dose the diahrrea reoccrred within 8 hours. I am out $100+.  Very annoying.  why is tis not listed as a possible unwanted effect.

column2: Robert, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had severve back and neck pain. Took Vicodin.  Was provided 500 mg twice a day of Limbrel.  My pain is practically all in remission after two months.  I can not believe how this has helped me.

column2: nester, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have a very rare autoimmune disease called relapsing polychondritis.  It affects my entire body and destroys cartilage throughout and some organs are also involved.  I also have Rhuematoid Arthritis.  It took years to diagnose me but I found a wonderful rheumatologist who finally diagnosed me with this rare autoimmune. (after visiting Mayo four times and four other rheumatologists who could not figure it out)  I asked about this food medicine and he agreed to hold off on chemotherapy and let me see if the Limbrel would help.  He actually had samples of it in his office!  He also put me on 3000 mg of omega 3, 6 & 9 daily.It has been almost two months and I feel different - much better.  I've even been sleeping better and I believe this is due to the decrease of inflammation throughout my body.  I can still feel the underlying RP and RA but all of my joints are a little better.  Pain not as excruciating and unbearable.For those of you who ended up in the emergency room and were told it was the Limbrel causing your symptoms, I believe were misinformed.  I have taken every kind of medicine out there and all that they did was cause other side effects.  The only side effect I have experienced with Limbrel is nausea, but I was nauseated before I started taking it, so is it the drug?This is one side effect I'm willing to chance vs the toxins of other drugs!!  I think it's unfair of those who insist that all of their misfortunes of health issues were caused from this wonderful drug!  I would bet that they had underlying diseases which were not being diagnosed.........just saying.....A HUNDRED THUMBS UP FOR FOOD MEDICINE!!!!

column2: PEGGY, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: SO FAR IT HAS BEEN ONE OT MANY THAT I'VE TRIED THAT HAD'T MADE ME SICK MY STOMACH AND HELPED SOME .

column2: dasrn98@msn.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have lupus.Have had aching painful joints in my fingers elbows, shoulders and hips. My doctors had tried to find medication i could take. But each one i either had the rare side effects or i was allergic to it. My pain level became severe and my mobility and daily routine was seriously decreased.Iwent to a new MD and was given a prescription for Limbrel 500-50 one cap twice a day. I was a skeptic. He explained to me that it was a flavanoid and  favan product. There should not be any side effects. And he had had good results with it from other patients. I love this man. First the first time in years my pain level is manageable. My joints have more quality of movement. My fingers are fantastic. No pain.No stiffness. Just Movement as they are suppose to no aching no pain. I recommend this for people who had painful joints. Fantastic medicine. I am also discouraged with MD's that dont take Lupus pain and fatigue as something serious. This pain had affected my whole life. My family, work, social. I feel very much better. I thank the my MD and the makers of Limbrel. Thank you

column9: I do not tolerate anti-inflammatory drugs.  Due to a knee strain was prescribed this drug. I began to have throat irritation, followed by an increasing cough. column2: Suzze, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking 500 mg of Limbrel 2x daily for 3 months and it works well; more flexibility, less knots and less pain-helps moderately with the fatigue. My MD informed me today that there is a new program to help with the affordability of Limbrel. $60.00 per month for the prescription if purchased through a www.designrx.net (mail order or walk-in). I am so glad that the tis program is available for all of us who can't afford the $160 per month charge.

column2: rfl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was given Limbrel for osteoarthritis.  After taking Limbrel for a few days, I developed a cough, runny nose, and nausea.  I thought it was a bad cold.  It went on for weeks.  After about a month on this drug and 3 trips to the doctor, I developed severe breathing problems.  I spent 1 week in the hospital and Dr.'s could find anything wrong.  I stopped the Limbrel and with the medrol I was given in the hospital, I started getting better.  I was getting better day by day for about 2 weeks.  I took 2 500 mg. Limbrel tablets in 1 day not knowing this was the problem and developed the same shortness of breath, severe cough, along with fever, chills, body aches, and headache.  Be aware of all the side effects that can be caused before taking this drug.  It causes hypersensitivity pneumonitis which is what has happened to me.  I consider this a very dangerous drug.

column2: Suzze, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take 500 mg 2 times a day and at first I had a slight change in bowel habits and flatulence. that stopped by the end of the thrd week on the drug. I am less stiff and after 15 years of Fibromylagia, this is the first medication that I really have no side effects other than just feeling better. I can't say it takes away all pain and I feel great, but I am much worse without it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Use for OA.  Ihave had no pain after 2 weeks on med. No other side effects. No reoccurance of RA since starting Limbrel.

column2: diva, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have been taking Limbrel for  about 4 years, and it's been like a miracle drug for my osteoarthritis. Just got on medicare,and lost my group coverage. No supplements pay for it. Price is out of range. Will have to switch to extra strength Tylenol. Needs a BIG price adjustment!!!!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this medication really makes me tired. just started taking it yesterday.i feel like i haven't slept.

column2: gdcstudios1, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: First of all, I am a very healthy person that happens to have osteoarthritis as a function of my age. After a certain time using Limbrel I developed an unexplainable fever accompanied by chills,body aches,nausea,and fatigue. I had to be hospitalized for 4 days and received 3 units of blood for extreme anemia. The anemia could not be explained, neither could the blood in my stool. After an upper and lower GI work-up nothing significant could be found to explain the blood loss. People should be aware that Limbrel can cause all these side effects. I am 100% better after discontinuing the drug. The slight improvement I found to my osteoarthritis is not worth the terrible way Limbrel made me feel in general.

column2: Erik2136, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This Medication has done wonders for my S-I joint which in turn has reduced some sciatic pain. Lots of insurance company's don't cover it yet because it still is an herbal/dietary supplement, but a one month supply at CVS is about $160, which unfortunately is very cheap for a brand name drug. There is no generic for this medication at this time. Sometimes insurance company's will pay if you appeal, your pharmacist will have all the information you'll need to try to appeal or get a pre-authorization, but the work will be worth it if you're able to get it. The med is not addictive which is an instant plus because doctors will not be as hesitant to write an Rx for it.
